bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luther M. Cornwall Books, November 21, 1941

div1.p: Hench inquires about used copies of government documents, and encloses a list of them for Cornwall.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luther M. Cornwall Books, November 21, 1941
div1.opener:
Same letter to
W H Lowdermilk, Books.
1418 F Street N W
Washington, D. C.
November 21, 1941
Luther M. Cornwall, Books
723 - 11th Street N. W.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Mr. Alton Tisdel of the U. S. Government printing
Office, tells me that you may have second hand copies of
certain old government documents no longer available in the
Printing Office. I am anxious to have those listed on the
enclosed sheet. Do you have any of them? I would appreciate
greatly a prompt reply.

If you do not have any of these can you give me
the name of any pamphlet or book store in Washington or
elsewhere that might have them? I enclose a stamped en-
velope for your reply.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
